description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dmurp","text":"This PCR protocol has been used to amplify the Cytochrome Oxydase I gene of neo-caledonian genera Boeckella, Lynceus, Latonopsis, Eulimnadia and Streptocephalus with several primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":109,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":118,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":130,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":145,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s7gf","text":"Prepare the mix for the PCR depending on the quantity of DNA samples you want to amplify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cd65u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e0vn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"euvu5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8km5v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6i341","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apb6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"271bh","text":"The quantities per well and for 96 DNA samples (with a 4 volumes margin) are detailed in the sub-steps","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5e6pq","text":"Be careful to take enough margin to avoid a lack of reagent and, if possible, do a positive and a negative control","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Don't forget to add margins in each mix for each different pair of primers you use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":114},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":120}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6svfj","text":"So, for 96 DNA samples with a 4 volume margin (100 volumes) and if you use the same primers for all 96 wells, add   and  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"3ADF38E430EA11EC81A20A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"selected H primer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"3ADF380E30EA11EC81A20A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"selected L primer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1},"mutability":"","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"curfr","text":"In each well, deposit   and   unless for the negative control.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"21s4b","text":"For the positive control, use the DNA of the species on which the primer has been designed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9tq4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"18","error":false,"guid":"87E8E37030EA11EC881C4D14DF91D833","id":"92999","label":"of the final reagent mix","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"F9A9DEF030EB11EC881C4D14DF91D833","id":"93000","label":"genomic DNA","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rqun","text":"Close the PCR plate with a heated aluminium foil and centrifuge it enough to make sure the reagents are all in the bottom of the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ofqh","text":"To amplify targeted DNA sequences, place your plate in the thermocycler, set and launch the cycle as described in the following sub-steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33tn4","text":"To know if your amplifications worked properly, you now have to proceed to a gel electrophoresis of your PCR products","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97rfb","text":"Pour the preparation in a mold and let the gel polymerize with a bar to form wells to deposit your PCR products","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
